definitions.definition: the hard protective outer case of a mollusk or crustacean.
the thin outer covering of an animal's egg, which is hard and fragile in that of a bird but leathery in that of a reptile.
the outer case of a nut kernel or seed.
examples: pod, husk, hull, casing, case, covering, integument, shuck peanut shells

definitions.definition: the carapace of a tortoise, turtle, or terrapin.
the wing cases of a beetle.
the integument of an insect pupa or chrysalis.
used with reference to a state of shyness or introversion.
examples: noun: one's shell; plural noun: one's shells

definitions.definition: something resembling or likened to a shell because of its shape or its function as an outer case.
the walls of an unfinished or gutted building or other structure.
examples: the hotel was a shell, the roof having collapsed completely

definitions.definition: an outer form without substance.
examples: he was a shell of the man he had been previously

definitions.definition: a light racing boat used in the sport of crew.
the metal framework of a vehicle body.
examples: framework, frame, chassis, skeleton; Morehull, exterior "the metal shell of the car"Morehull, exterior the metal shell of the car

definitions.definition: an inner or roughly made coffin.
the hand guard of a sword.
each of a set of orbitals around the nucleus of an atom, occupied or able to be occupied by electrons of similar energies.
an explosive artillery projectile or bomb.
examples: the sound of the shell passing over, followed by the explosion

definitions.definition: a hollow metal or paper case used as a container for fireworks, explosives, or cartridges.
a cartridge.
short for shell program.
bombard with shells.
examples: the guns started shelling their positions

definitions.definition: remove the shell or pod from (a nut or seed).
gather seashells.
examples: there was nothing to do except swim or go shelling on the beaches
